page.title: 07Industries in S.E. Guildford
page.content:
{Industry.}The Ministry of Agriculture, Fisheries and Food is a computerised office, dealing with administration in farming. It employs 600 people. There is also a publishing firm specialising in foreign travel picture books.
{Law and Order.}As well as the main Guildford police force there are two local policemen in the area. One covers Shalford and Peasmarsh and the other St. Martha's, Blackheath, Albury Heath and Rice's Corner. The main crimes are theft, burglary and speeding. The policemen travel around their areas on bicycles and work in shifts. On average there is one burglary a week, although they have decreased due to better security for houses e.g. burglar alarms. Both policemen live in their villages and are careful to maintain a good image.
